backend/main.mo: Defines an empty Motoko actor, serving as a placeholder backend entry point with no logic implemented.
feature_evidence.json: Documents feature evidence linking weather advice and UI rendering requirements to specific frontend files, components, tests, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Provides a high-level mapping of frontend source files to short descriptions of their responsibilities for documentation and planning.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS setup defining design tokens, OKLCH-based light/dark color variables, and base styles for consistent theming.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that mounts the React app to the root element and loads the main TypeScript module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Top-level React component managing app state, location selection flow, and React Query provider setup.
frontend/src/components/AdviceBanner.tsx: Renders contextual weather advice with icons, colors, and responsive text wrapping based on advice type and weather conditions.
frontend/src/components/AppLayout.tsx: Layout wrapper that composes the header, main content area, and footer with a responsive gradient background.
frontend/src/components/EmptyState.tsx: Landing screen component showing a hero image, introductory text, and a call-to-action to start a location search.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Footer displaying attribution, external data source credits, and branding with light/dark styling.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Header component showing the app logo, title, and tagline with gradient text styling.
frontend/src/components/LocationSearch.t: Implements location search UI with input, results list, loading and error states, backed by a geocoding hook.
frontend/src/components/WeatherPanel.tsx: Displays current weather data, location details, advice banner, and retry or location-change actions.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook that creates and caches a backend actor using React Query, switching between anonymous and authenticated actors based on Internet Identity. It invalidates and refetches dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useCurrentWeather.ts: React Query hook that fetches current weather data for a given latitude and longitude with a 10-minute cache and limited retries.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity authentication context, handling login, logout, persisted identities, and login status using Dfinity AuthClient. Exposes hooks and a provider to access identity state throughout the app.
frontend/src/hooks/usePlaceSearch.ts: React Query hook for searching places via a geocoding service, configured to run only when manually triggered and cache results briefly.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Empty placeholder file noting that all React Query hooks are defined in feature-specific hook files.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS base stylesheet defining global styles, CSS variables for light and dark themes, and a warm color palette used across the app.
frontend/src/lib/weatherAdvice.ts: Utility function that derives user-friendly weather advice messages based on current weather conditions such as rain, temperature, wind, or fog.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app, wrapping it with React Query and Internet Identity providers and loading global styles.
frontend/src/services/geocoding.ts: Service that queries the OpenStreetMap Nominatim API to search for places and normalizes results into internal Place objects.
frontend/src/services/weatherApi.ts: Service that fetches current weather data from the Open-Meteo API and maps raw response fields and weather codes into a WeatherData model.
frontend/src/types/weather.ts: Type definitions for place search results, weather data, and derived weather advice used throughout the frontend.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining theme extensions, color tokens via CSS variables, animations, plugins, and dark mode support.
project_state.json: Defines the projectâ€™s schema/version and a high-level summary of a weather app on Internet Computer, plus a catalog of existing features across Motoko backend, React frontend, auth, weather, UI, and build tooling. Also tracks feature updates and requirements for enhancements like actionable, emoji-inclusive weather advice and UI rendering constraints.
